description.en: The goal of the course is to provide understanding of principles of physical measurements. The main components of measuring instruments will be introduced. Students will learn about the limiting factors of measurement and about methods of accuracy enhancement. After the course, the students are expected to know the principles of measurement of length, velocity, acceleration, vibration, time, mass, force, deformation, pressure, viscosity, temperature, heat, electrical quantities, and optical quantities. They are expected to be able to conduct the measurement of physical quantities, to be able to assess the measurement accuracy and to be able to design a measuring apparatus on the basis of available sensor(s) and electronic components.
description.et: Tutvustatakse mõõtetehnika üldisi printsiipe ja mõõtmise energeetilisi aluseid. Käsitletakse erinevaid mõõtemuundureid (sh. termoelektrilisi, piesoelektrilisi, ülijuhtivaid) temperatuuri, vaakumi, rõhu, magnetvälja tugevuse ja teiste füüsikaliste suuruste mõõtmiseks. Aine on mõeldud rakendusfüüsika suuna magistrantidele.

objectives.en: The knowledge about principles of the measurement of physical quantities is provided
objectives.et: Antakse ülevaade füüsikaliste suuruste mõõtmise meetoditest.

learning_outcomes.en:
Students should acquire the knowledge of the following.
1. The  main constituent parts of the apparatus for physical measurements. The parameters characterizing the accurcy and sensitivity of the instruments and their limiting factors (different sources of noise). 
2. The various methods of enchancement of selectivity, accuracy and sensitivity (lock-in amplifier, modulation and demodulation of the signal, filtering and averaging, correlation analysis). 
3. The principles and apparatud for measuring the following physical quantities:
- temperature, heat quantity, heat conductivity. Thermography and its usage
- length, area, volume
- position in space (geopositioning)
- angle, triangulation
- velocity, acceleration, vibration
- sound
- time and frequency
- mass, density
- force, torque (rotational moment), pressure
- dynamical properties of gases and liquids (fow rate, viscosity)
- electrical parameters (voltage, current, resistance, power)
- photometric and radiometric quantities, color
4. Principles of physical measurement applications in medicine (different types of tomography, encephalography, blood pressure, bio-potential).
learning_outcomes.et:
Kursuse läbinud üliõpilane
1. Teab füüsikalisteks mõõtmisteks kasutatavate aparaatide peamisi koostisosi ja mõõtmistäpsust ja tundlikkust iseloomustavaid parameetreid ja neid limiteerivaid faktoreid (müra erinevad liigid).
2. Teab mõõtmistäpsuse ja tundlikkuse tõstmise erinevaid meetodeid (sünkroonlukustusega võimendid, signaali moduleerimine-demoduleerimine, filtreerimine, korrelatsioonanalüüs).
3. Tunneb järgmiste  füüsikaliste suuruste mõõtmise printsiipe ja aparaate:
- Temperatuur, soojushulk, soojusjuhtivus, termograaf.
- Pikkus, pindala, ruumala.
- Positsioon ruumis (geopositsioneerimine).
- Nurk, triangulatsioon.
- Kiirus, kiirendus ja vibratsioon.
- Aeg ja sagedus.
- Mass, tihedus, jõud, pöördemoment, rõhk.
- Gaaside ja vedelike dünaamilised omadused (vooluhulk, viskoossus).
- Heli.
- Elektrilised suurused (pinge, voolutugevus, võimsus, takistus).
- Fotomeetrilised ja radiomeetrilised suurused.
4. Teab füüsikaliste mõõtmiste rakendusi meditsiinis (biopotentsiaal, vererõhk, tomograafia).

description.et:
1. Methods of physical measurement
1.1 The general principles of measuring physical quantities
Measuring instruments and their metrological properties
The principal components of a measuring instrument – sensor, converter, amplifier, output device
The characteristics of a measuring instrument – response characteristics, sensitivity, measuring threshold, resolution, response time, repeatability

1.2 The limiting factors of measurement
Thermal noise, shot noise, quantum noise
Sensitivity of measuring instrument to external factors (temperature, humidity, power supply parameters etc.)

1.3 Methods of enchancement of accuracy and sensitivity
Modulation and filtration of signal
Lock-in and narrow-band amplifiers, heterodyne
Spectral and correlation analysis
Compensation methods
Sensor networks: optically linked mesuring systems, telemetry
1.4 Measuring instruments calibration and check with standards

2. The principles and instruments for measuring physical quantities
2.1 Measurement of length and related quantities
The measurement of length, height, area, volume
The measurement of position (geopositioning)
The measurement of angle, military applications
The measurement of speed, acceleration and vibration
The measurement of time and frequency

2.2 Measurement of mass and force
The measurement of mass
The measurement of density
The measurement of force
The measurement of torque
The measurement of deformation
The measurement of pressure

2.3 Measurement of dynamic characteristics of gases and liquids
The measurement of gas and liquid flow
The measurement of viscosity
The measurement of sound

2.4 Measurement of temperature and heat
The measurement of temperature
The measurement of thermal conductivity
The measurement of thermal flow
Thermo graphics
Calorimetry

2.5 Measurement of electrical and magnetic quantities
The measurement of electrical voltage and current
The measurement of electrical energy and power
The measurement of electrical resistance
The measurement of electrical capacitance and inductance
The measurement of dielectric constant
The measurement of electrical field
The measurement of magnetic field and magnetic inductance

2.6 Photometric and radiometric measurements
The measurement of optical image (photography)
The measurement of optical density (densitometry)
The measurement of color (colorimetry)
The measurement of polarization
The measurement of refraction index
The measurement of parameters of laser radiation
The measurement of radioactivity, dosimetry
The measurement of charged particles
The measurement of neutrons

2.7 The applications of physical measurements in medicine
The measurement of biopotential
The measurement of blood pressure
The NMR tomography and X-ray tomography
Densitometry of bones (DEXA)
